article.headline: Colgate 73, Long Beach State 71
article.story: LONG BEACH, Calif. (AP) -- Alvin Reed scored 14 points and made four free throws in the final 15.9 seconds to give Colgate a 73-71 victory over Long Beach State Tuesday. Reed was 6-for-6 from the line and dished out five assists to lead Colgate to their third win in four games. Trailing 68-67 with 2:50 remaining, the Red Raiders forced three 49er turnovers and held Long Beach State to one basket for the remainder of the game to secure the victory. Kendall Chones' layup with 1:30 left gave Colgate (6-4) a 68-67 lead. Louis Darby missed a driving layup and Jibril Hodges committed a turnover in the final 20-seconds that cost Long Beach State a chance to tie. Chones had 12 points, Mark Linebaugh had 11 and Jon Foss had 10 for Colgate. Kevin Roberts made 10 of 16 shots, and scored a season-high 24 points for Long Beach State (2-7). The 49ers erased a seven point deficit and held Colgate to one basket over the final 3:45 of the first half to take a 35-34 lead at halftime.
